Félix Rose

Publication list Curriculum vitae

Curriculum vitae

Research experience

  • 2023 - present: Non-permanent lecturer at the Laboratory of Theoretical Physics and Modelling, CY Cergy Paris Université.
  • 2023: Postdoctoral researcher at the Institute for Theoretical Physics of the University of Heidelberg (Germany) in the group of Prof. Tilman Enss.
  • 2019 - 2022: Postdoctoral researcher at the Max Planck Institute of Quantum Optics (Germany), in Dr. Richard Schmidt’s group, part of the Theory Division.
  • 2017 - 2019: Postdoctoral researcher at the Technical University of Munich (Germany), in Prof. Wilhelm Zwerger’s group.
  • 2014 - 2017: Ph.D. candidate at Université Pierre et Marie Curie, Paris (France).
    • Advisor: Dr. Nicolas Dupuis.
    • Dissertation title: Dynamics and transport in the vicinity of a two-dimensional quantum critical point.
  • 2013: Masters intern at Université Paris Sud, Orsay (France).
    • Advisor: Dr. Mark Goerbig.
    • Dissertation title: Bidimensionnal electrons in molybdenium disulfide.

Education

  • 2017: Ph.D. in Physics, Université Pierre et Marie Curie, Paris (France).
  • 2014: M.Sc. in Physics, École normale supérieure, Paris (France).
  • 2014: M.Sc. in Engineering, École Polytechnique, Palaiseau (France).
  • 2012: B.Sc. in Engineering, École Polytechnique, Palaiseau (France).

Teaching experience

  • 2023 - present: Lecturer, CY Cergy Paris Université.
  • 2023: Teaching assistant, University of Heidelberg.
    • Advanced quantum mechanics (graduate).
  • 2018 - 2019: Teaching assistant and coordinator, Technical University of Munich.
    • Theory of condensed matter (graduate).
  • 2014 - 2017: Teaching assistant, Université Pierre et Marie Curie.
    • Tutoring in mathematics (undergraduate).
    • Introduction to Mathematica (undergraduate).
    • Quantum statistical physics (graduate).
  • 2014: Teaching assistant, École Polytechnique.
    • Individual tutoring in elementary quantum mechanics.
